meanings.definition: To supply (food, drink, or other goods) as provisions.
meanings.sent1: The kind farmer was purveying fresh vegetables to the local market.
meanings.sent2: The grocery store is purveying a wide variety of snacks for the party.
meanings.sent3: The chef joked that he was purveying happiness in the form of delicious desserts.
meanings.sent4: The charity organization is purveying hope to those in need through their food donations.
meanings.sent5: The bakery was purveying the aroma of freshly baked bread throughout the neighborhood.

meanings.sent1: The library is purveying knowledge through its vast collection of books.
meanings.sent2: The company is purveying essential supplies to the remote village.
meanings.sent3: The magician claimed he could purvey magic tricks to entertain the audience.
meanings.sent4: The teacher is purveying wisdom to her students through engaging lessons.
meanings.sent5: The store is purveying comfort with its soft blankets and cozy pillows.

meanings.definition: To spread or promote (an idea, view, etc.).
meanings.sent1: The activist is purveying the message of environmental conservation to the community.
meanings.sent2: The influencer is purveying the latest fashion trends on social media.
meanings.sent3: The comedian is purveying laughter to his audience with his hilarious jokes.
meanings.sent4: The artist is purveying creativity through her unique paintings.
meanings.sent5: The musician is purveying emotions through the heartfelt lyrics of his songs.
